abstract: Governments from more than 190 countries adopt measure that will force airline carriers to improve fuel economy by 2021, at International Civil Aviation Organization in Montreal; Sec of State John Kerry says measure addresses growing source of greenhouse emissions and avoids patchwork of overlapping national and regional regulations; analysts predict agreement will boost sales of fuel efficient planes.
lead_paragraph: The measure takes effect in 2021 and will reduce the climate impact of international jet travel. The first six years will be voluntary.
snippet: The measure takes effect in 2021 and will reduce the climate impact of international jet travel. The first six years will be voluntary....

headline.main: Over 190 Countries Adopt Plan to Offset Air Travel Emissions
headline.print_headline: Countries Agree to Climate Accord on Jet Emissions
